review_title: Overall good experience, good hospital, just short staffed
job_title: Patient Care Assistant (PCA) in Northampton, MA
pros: Great coworkers, feel like I'm making a difference, good experience. Shift differentials. Immediate higher ups are wonderful - director will even come in and help out on the floor when short staffed.
cons: Short staffed like every hospital.

job_title: Certified Medical Assistant in Amherst, MA
pros: They have great benefits, my insurance is honestly one of the best I've ever had.
cons: The pay is not great. They have a union that you have to be a part of and they don't give you a difference in pay as a certified medical assistant.

review_title: Love my coworkers, hate the system

pros: People are great. Best nurses and techs I've ever met.
cons: Management's goal is to get as much as they can from you for as little as possible. Same story as all hospitals. Extremely frustrating. Manipulative and unjust.

job_title: Registered Nurse in Northampton, MA

job_title: Director, Facilities Management in Northampton, MA
pros:
If you are looking to start out at the ground level and work toward a career in healthcare this is the place for you. We have many entry level positions that will put you directly in line with the career of your choice and even open your eyes to options you never knew existed. 

Maybe you have simply established yourself already just looking for a environment which is community driven, team focused and culturally diverse. We only hope that you will come meet our team and decide for yourself if this is the right place for you.
cons: Once joining the team it will be hard to say goodbye.

job_title: Not Available. in Northampton, MA
pros: There are many good staff members who work hard to provide the necessary care for patients.
cons: When I worked there, they seemed to be asking staff for their contribution to the hospital, yet spending money on a myriad of consultants.  I thought that senior staff were employed because of their experience in specific areas.  Why then is it necessary to bring in consultants for what seems like every little thing?  Also, there was no system of merit raises, so that someone who was doing an outstanding job got the same raise as someone who, eg, could be on probation.  Does that make sense?

review_title: Wonderful team approach to respectful employee treatment and great patient care.
job_title: Physical Therapist II in Hadley, MA
pros: Great team dynamics, respectful and appreciative leadership, CEO Joanne is amazing and has really placed respect for team dynamics as her primary goal (no more God complexes), competitive salaries and benefits, focus and attention to patient care more than dollars is awesome (45 min treatments are almost unheard of anymore).
cons: Since merging with Mass General many things are great (like more and better resources) but the future red tape is showing itself ever more present and likely to interfere with getting things done with any sense of efficiency.

review_title: I went for one job, but was given another which was confusing, but I ended up liking the job they gave me very much.
job_title: Physician Assistant in Northampton, MA
pros: Laid back atmosphere, small hospital, friendly people (mostly!).
cons: In-house disagreements about staffing which were not worked out before I went on-site to perform the job for which I was hired.

job_title: in Northampton, MA
pros: Great co workers who support each other and are there for the patients. The satisfaction of seeing a patient recover and go home.
cons: Standing on concrete floors for 8 or 12 hours a day, Having a health insurance that is privatley funded so they have the right to deny services that should be covered by law.

job_title: Manager in Northampton, MA
pros: They have the support of a bigger hospital and network to assist in financial issues or operational support including the clinical departments.
cons: The culture as far as trustworthiness is by far the worst I have ever worked in. Everyone is out for themselves and will stick a knife in your back as soon as you walk away. There are some very nice people that work there but you can only trust a handful at best.

review_title: If it had not been for personalities that needed to control the situation I would still be there today.
job_title: Registered Nurse in Northampton, MA
pros: workplace in itself was up to date and expanding (2006) New wing being built.
cons: Lack of teamwork. It was each man or woman for him/herself. There was nothing in place for lateral bullying.
